intro: Bunchosia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan bunchosia, is a shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Bunchosia guatemalensis is often found in dry, disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
